tool.name: IDMassAccuracy
tool.description: Calculates a distribution of the mass error from given mass spectra and IDs.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ${ ' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in/%s.%s' &&" % (_, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in if _]) } mkdir id_in && ${ ' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'id_in/%s.%s' &&" % (_, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $id_in if _]) } #if "out_precursor_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out_precursor && #end if #if "out_fragment_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out_fragment && #end if #if "out_precursor_fit_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out_precursor_fit && #end if #if "out_fragment_fit_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out_fragment_fit && #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && export PYTHONPATH='$__tool_directory__/CTDopts/' && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in ${' '.join(["'in/%s.%s'"%(re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in if _])} -id_in ${' '.join(["'id_in/%s.%s'"%(re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $id_in if _])} #if "out_precursor_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out_precursor 'out_precursor/output.${gxy2omsext("tabular")}' #end if #if "out_fragment_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out_fragment 'out_fragment/output.${gxy2omsext("tabular")}' #end if #if "out_precursor_fit_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out_precursor_fit 'out_precursor_fit/output.${gxy2omsext("tabular")}' #end if #if "out_fragment_fit_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out_fragment_fit 'out_fragment_fit/output.${gxy2omsext("tabular")}' #end if #if len(str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',')) == 0 | tee '$stdout' #end if
## Postprocessing #if "out_precursor_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out_precursor/output.${gxy2omsext("tabular")}' '$out_precursor' #end if #if "out_fragment_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out_fragment/output.${gxy2omsext("tabular")}' '$out_fragment' #end if #if "out_precursor_fit_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out_precursor_fit/output.${gxy2omsext("tabular")}' '$out_precursor_fit' #end if #if "out_fragment_fit_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out_fragment_fit/output.${gxy2omsext("tabular")}' '$out_fragment_fit' #end if #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in
param.label: Input mzML file list, containing the spectra

param.name: id_in
param.label: Input idXML file list, containing the identifications

param.name: out_precursor_FLAG
param.label: Generate output out_precursor (Output file which contains the deviations from the precursors)

param.name: precursor_error_ppm
param.label: If this flag is used, the precursor mass tolerances are estimated in ppm instead of Da

param.name: out_fragment_FLAG
param.label: Generate output out_fragment (Output file which contains the fragment ion m/z deviations)

param.name: fragment_error_ppm
param.label: If this flag is used, the fragment mass tolerances are estimated in ppm instead of Da

param.name: fragment_mass_tolerance
param.label: Maximal fragment mass tolerance which is allowed for MS/MS spectra, used for the calculation of matching ions

param.name: number_of_bins
param.label: Number of bins that should be used to calculate the histograms for the fitting

param.name: out_precursor_fit_FLAG
param.label: Generate output out_precursor_fit (Gaussian fit to the histogram of mass deviations from the precursors)

param.name: out_fragment_fit_FLAG
param.label: Generate output out_fragment_fit (Gaussian fit to the histogram of mass deviations from the fragments)

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

tool.help:
Calculates a distribution of the mass error from given mass spectra and IDs.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/documentation/UTILS_IDMassAccuracy.html
